image.altText: A young woman in a gym wearing blue bike pants and crop top, lunging with a weighted bag on her back.

props.synopsis: Thousands of social media followers are trying out the hybrid training model, but experts say the intense training style can be harmful, if not done correctly.

title.children: Hyrox training is trending on social media, but it's not new in the gym

image.altText: A large housing construction site with multiple excavators on the edge of a bush block.

props.synopsis: The second stage of Canberra suburb Denman Prospect was set to be built on Bluetts Block in the Molonglo Valley, but it has now been declared a nature reserve to preserve its ecological value.

title.children: 'Lovely piece of bushland' at Canberra's edge spared from development

image.altText: Two men in an office monitoring traffic on a large video board.

props.synopsis: Road authorities are urging Canberra drivers to avoid taking illegal and potentially dangerous shortcuts to avoid increased peak hour traffic due to the closure of the western side of London Circuit for light rail construction.

title.children: Traffic congestion prompts ACT authorities to take action on illegal driving

image.altText: A man with a handlebar moustache smiles while holding the handles of a penny farthing.

props.synopsis: Perched atop a penny farthing while playing classical guitar, Simon Weir is something of a local celebrity in Canberra — and now he's preparing to compete at the National Penny Farthing Championships.

title.children: Penny farthing while playing guitar helps Simon prepare for championships

image.altText: exterior view of aged care facility

props.synopsis: Access to respite aged care in Canberra will become even tougher from June, when the ACT government will shut a 15-bed facility in Canberra's south.

title.children: Aged care respite facility to be shut despite growing demand

image.altText: Judge Salvatore Vasta

props.synopsis: Federal Circuit Court Judge Salvatore Vasta has won his High Court bid for immunity from being sued by a man wrongly jailed during a family property dispute.

title.children: Federal Circuit Court Judge wins High Court bid for immunity

image.altText: A man with grey hair stands outside smiling.

props.synopsis: Almost a century after it was taken from Gamilaraay country in New South Wales, a sacred tree known as a dhulu is returned by a Swiss museum.

title.children: Sacred tree returned to Australia after eight decades in Swiss museum

image.altText: Shorten stands speaking in the prime minister's courtyard.

props.synopsis: A speechwriter hired on a $600,000, two-year contract to write speeches for Services Australia and its minister Bill Shorten, has joined him at his new job at the University of Canberra.

title.children: Bill Shorten's $300k speechwriter follows him to University of Canberra

image.altText: outside view of federal court in australia

props.synopsis: A group of Canberra's social housing tenants are set to get their day in the Federal Court, with the way cleared for a class action against the ACT government over a plan to move them from their homes.

title.children: Class action by social housing tenants cleared to run

image.altText: Woman in white three-quarter sleeve dress seated with hand on knee of her partner, a man in jeans and shirt. They sit outside

props.synopsis: When Laura and Colin's partners died suddenly from the same condition, they were shocked to find themselves falling in love while still grieving.

title.children: When widower Col found new love, he never expected to lose friends over it

image.altText: Hand holding phone showing serious older balding man wear white sleeveless vest, blue checked sarong sitting in a blue room.

props.synopsis: For three weeks, the body of Pastor Subhash Baghel languished in a morgue, his burial blocked by local Hindu tribal groups refusing to allow him to be laid to rest in his own village.

title.children: Pastor denied burial as Christians and Hindus clash over conversions

image.altText: For sale sign in front of apartment building

props.synopsis: A two-year ban on the foreign purchase of existing Australian homes is now bipartisan policy.

title.children: Labor matches Coalition ban on foreign housing investment

image.altText: A close up photo of Lynda McMinn, who is wearing a clerical collar, green cardigan and teal spectacles

props.synopsis: Thirty-three years ago, to much celebration, women were made priests in the Anglican Diocese of Canberra and Goulburn. A new era, it was thought, had begun.

title.children: Why a female priest stays when so many women have left the church

image.altText: Glass and spoon of apple cider vinegar surrounded by red apples.

props.synopsis: Apple cider vinegar is so popular in the wellness world that it's being used as the title of a new TV series about disgraced influencer Belle Gibson. But is it actually good for you?

title.children: Should you drink apple cider vinegar? Here are the real health impacts

image.altText: A woman smiles in front of a sign that reads Karumba Community Church

props.synopsis: Thousands of kilometres from home, backpackers revive a church in a tiny Queensland town, leaving a lasting mark in the community that extends beyond their own time there.

title.children: Outback town's church left to rot reopened by backpackers

image.altText: A woman being crowned at a pageant

props.synopsis: The Miss Pacific Islands pageant is supposed to celebrate culture and togetherness. But this week it has been defined by allegations of fraud, bullying and lies.

title.children: Beauty pageant saga 'bullying and lies' as police investigate 'fraud'

image.altText: Tom Gleeson standing with his arms crossed with a serious look on his face with th Hard quiz logo in the top left corner

props.synopsis: Don't worry, I'm expecting another mediocre result. Go on, prove me wrong.

title.children: Think your intellect is a match for my quiz? I doubt it

image.altText: Two man stand on street wearing black suits. One smiles and one has serious expression.

props.synopsis: Industry resignations and anger have followed the shock decision by Creative Australia to drop artist Khaled Sabsabi from one of the world's most prestigious cultural events.

title.children: Resignations and anger as industry reacts to artist dropped from event

image.altText: Two men in safety gear rappel down a large, curved roof to inspect a heavily damaged section.

props.synopsis: A drone armed with an explosive warhead pierced the containment shell over Chernobyl's melted-down nuclear reactor early on Friday morning, causing a small fire but major concerns for peace prospects.

title.children: A drone struck Chernobyl. It may damage peace talks more than concrete

props.synopsis: Around-the-clock coverage of news events as they break, at home and abroad.

title.children: Watch: News Channel

image.altText: Innovators

props.synopsis: Two men, from opposite ends of the world, within the space of two years both dared to change cricket, by hitting the ball where most thought it could not be hit.

title.children: How men from two ends of the world have claims to cricket's ramp shot

image.altText: Elon Musk standing behind a podium, raising his fists in the air and shouting.

props.synopsis: There has been an escalation in the legal battles over billionaire Elon Musk's new US government efficiency agency. Here's what we know about DOGE.

title.children: Is Elon Musk orchestrating a coup? Here's what we know about DOGE

image.altText: Top half of the image is a sketch of the bays harbour precinct, the bottom half if a real-life artist impression of the area.

props.synopsis: Once upon a time Disneyland representatives were interested in this inner west spot in Sydney — now the site is set to be a bustling precinct for housing, work and recreation instead.

title.children: From theme park interest to bustling hub: inside Sydney's new Bays Precinct

image.altText: A school class photo featuring more than 20 students with one child left out. The left out child is symbolized by a silhouette

props.synopsis: As South Australia's parliament considers new child protection laws, advocates are questioning whether the state has become "over-zealous" in protecting children from harm.

title.children: Student's removal from class photos sparks debate over SA's child protection laws

image.altText: A group of people running in a marathon.

props.synopsis: Athletes competing and training in hot, humid climates are faced with a different set of challenges, and with a warming climate, experts say learning to adapt is key.

title.children: Training in heat, humidity and pollution brings big challenges

image.altText: Tina Fey and Amy Poehler stand at a podium, impersonating Sarah Palin and Hillary Clinton.

props.synopsis: For the past half-century, US sketch show Saturday Night Live has defied the odds, delivering weekly live shows and lifting up some of the most famous comedy creators in history.

title.children: From The Muppets to Wayne's World — SNL changed comedy over 50 years

image.altText: Jacob Laban celebrates with Maori All Star teammates after scoring winning try

props.synopsis: The Maori hold out the Indigenous to win a low-scoring men's All Stars clash, hours after the Indigenous claimed a last-gasp win in the women's clash through a late penalty.

title.children: Maori and Indigenous All Stars share spoils across razor-tight NRL exhibitions

image.altText: Bobby Hill dances with teammates in celebration of a goal for the Indigenous All Stars

props.synopsis: Bobby Hill kicked four goals and Jy Simpkin ran rampant in the midfield as the Indigenous All Stars put on a spectacle in a 43-point win over Fremantle at Perth Stadium.

title.children: Indigenous All Stars put on a show in victory over Fremantle

image.altText: A person holds a maugean skate out of the water.

props.synopsis: Anthony Albanese has written to the salmon industry to confirm laws will be introduced that will protect salmon farms on Tasmania's west coast.

title.children: Prime minister promises law change to protect salmon farms

image.altText: sydney train commuters carry bags as they try board a packed train at a sydney rail station

props.synopsis: At least a quarter of Sydney's trains services were cancelled on Friday when hundreds of staff failed to show up for work with further staff absences impacting services today.

title.children: Train drivers 'coordinated' sick day to disrupt services, tribunal told

image.altText: Michael Filby

props.synopsis: Michael Filby has spent two decades picking up rubbish along the road and says it's time others pitched in.

title.children: After 20 years of picking up rubbish, this volunteer wants some help

image.altText: A woman looking on with a neutral expression on her face.

props.synopsis: Russia's foreign ministry has criticised the ABC and its Four Corners program over its most recent report, which took audiences inside a Ukrainian drone unit fighting Vladimir Putin's forces.

title.children: Four Corners Ukraine report sparks angry Russian government response

image.altText: Jay-z 2025

props.synopsis: Jay-Z said in a statement that today was a victory and "the trauma that my wife, my children, my loved ones and I have endured can never be dismissed."

title.children: 'Fictitious and appalling' rape allegations against Jay-Z dismissed

image.altText: A man standing with his arms folded, looking at another man who is sitting and speaking

props.synopsis: The US president promised to move quickly on his return to the White House, but the pace he's set in his first four weeks has still left many in Washington scrambling.

title.children: Donald Trump's information overload tells us a lot about his strategy

image.altText: nsw ambulance and two police officer hold up at green tarp outside a house in mayfield after officers tasered and shot a man

props.synopsis: A critical incident investigation is underway after a man, believed to be in his 40s, was tasered and shot by police at Mayfield, in the NSW Hunter region.

title.children: Man allegedly carrying meat cleaver tasered and shot by police
